direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods decorate a collection to provide additional behavior (unmodifiability vs. synchronization).
Both methods create an unmodifiable version of a collection, though one is specifically for bounded collections.
Both methods involve accessing the underlying decorated collection, which is a common pattern in decorator implementations.
Both methods involve creating an iterator for the collection, though one is specifically unmodifiable.
Both methods depend on the state of the underlying bounded collection, specifically checking if it is full.
